citation.article-title: Alterococcus agarolyticus, gen. nov., sp. nov., a halophilic thermophilic bacterium capable of agar degradation.

p.s: Altercoccus (L. alter another; Gr. n. coccus a grain or berry; M.L. masc. n. Alterococcus another coccus)
Motility coccus by means of a single flagellum.
Facultatively anaerobic heterotrophs capable of both aerobic and anaerobic fermentative growth.
Moderately thermophilic, growing at 40-55°C but not at 30 or 60°C.
Slightly halophilic, growing in media containing 1-3% NaCl but not in those containing 0-5% NaCl.
Anteiso-15-carbon acid (aneiso-C15:0) is the most abundant cellular fatty acid.
The G+C of the DNA of the strains so far examined is in the range of 65.5-67.0 mol%.
The type species is Alterococcus agarolyticus.
